selected_quotes: Number perception by college students and guppies - more similar than you might think
Quantity Discrimination - Counting - In Both Humans And Fish Shares The Same Evolutionary Basis
Surprising IQ! Fish compare large numbers equal to college students see #animals #brain #biology
Undergrads and guppies show surprising similarities in numerical approximation

citation.abstract: Humans and non-human animals share an approximate non-verbal system for representing and comparing numerosities that has no upper limit and for which accuracy is dependent on the numerical ratio. Current evidence indicates that the mechanism for keeping track of individual objects can also be used for numerical purposes; if so, its accuracy will be independent of numerical ratio, but its capacity is limited to the number of items that can be tracked, about four. There is, however, growing controversy as to whether two separate number systems are present in other vertebrate species.
citation.title: Evidence for Two Numerical Systems That Are Similar in Humans and Guppies

video.summary:
From horses that do math (not really) to counting ants, here's a compilation of my favorite research on the numerical abilities of animals. http://www.learningnerd.com/number-sense-animals/

I wish I could include more, but I just wanted to show a glimpse

blogs.title: Fish can estimate
blogs.summary: Humans have at least two distinct ways of evaluating the numbers of objects.  For very small numbers (usually no more than four or five) we can immediately tell how many items there are without counting.  For larger numbers, we can compare relative amounts

wikipedia.title: Approximate number system
wikipedia.summary: The approximate number system (ANS) is a cognitive system that supports the estimation of the magnitude of a group without relying on language or symbols.

wikipedia.title: Parallel individuation system
wikipedia.summary: The Parallel individuation system, also called object tracking system is a non-symbolic cognitive system that supports the representation of numerical values from zero to three (in infants) or four (in adults and non-human animals).

wikipedia.title: Numerical cognition
wikipedia.summary: Numerical cognition is a subdiscipline of cognitive science that studies the cognitive, developmental and neural bases of numbers and mathematics.

news.title: Size matters to lizards, but numbers may not
news.summary: Your daily roundup of research news Science News Staff Tests in Italian ruin or wall lizards suggests that the reptiles can assess dinner based on volume differences between two food ideas but not on the number of food items available.

news.title: Dyscalculia: Number games
news.summary: Brian Butterworth is on a crusade to understand the number deficit called dyscalculia — and to help those who have it. Nature 493 150 doi: 10.1038/493150a
